Maximum allowable background level for tracker operations.

argument.description: 0 will result in always excluding tracker. 1023 will effectively disable the check.

description.text: 0=Disable usage if MaxLevel exceeded, 1=Go to Idle mode if MaxLevel exceeded.
Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_TrackerCtrl_TEST_TrackerTestMode
command.description: Bypass attitude calculation, and use attitude injected via LVDS test port. Not for use with RDP simulation.

description.text: 0=Disable, Test data ignored. 1=AttData, Only injected attitude is use.
Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCtrl_AllowSunModel
command.description: WARNING: This command alters core sun point mode sensor paths. This command also changes the RAM table value controlling the usage logic. Allows/disallows the usage of the sun model (based on time and attitude knowledge) in sun point mode as a back-up option to the measured sun vector. This usage only has an effect when the preferred sun source is set to MEASURED.

argument.description: states: 0=disabled, 1=enabled; Enables or disables back-up usage of the time-based sun model when both time and attitude are valid.

description.text: Enables use of GPS data. (Default is enable.)
states: 0=disable, 1=enable
Take a test image with the detector. TEST ONLY
Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_Tables_FlashBurnArm
command.description: To avoid accidental burns to FLASH, this command must be send to arm FLASH burning capability. When FLASH burn is disarmed (the default), FlashBurnDirect and FlashBurnCopy will be rejected.

description.text: states: 0=DISARM, 1=ARM

command.name: cmd_adcs_Wheel_TEST_RwTestMode
command.description: Sets RW module in test mode. Idle's physical wheels if present and uses the wheel speed read from the RDP for attitude control loop closure. NOTE: This is not required for closed loop simulations that have physical wheels. This is used for closed loop sim in the absence of wheels.

description.text: states: 0=disable, 1=enable; Enable or disable test mode for closed loop testing

0 based

command.name: cmd_adcs_Cal_TrackerAlignUsage
command.description: Configures usage of the dynamic estimate of Tracker 2 alignment with respect to Tracker 1. Sending this command with UseConfig=2 updates the TrackerCtrl table (in RAM only) and therefore is effectively a table load operation--do not perform simultaneous to any other table operations.

argument.description: states: 0=Use RAM table alignment on each cycle, 1=Use dynamic estimate on each cycle, 2=Jam dynamic estimate into RAM table once then switch to UseConfig 0

command.name: cmd_adcs_GPS_AcceptTimePosVel
command.description: This command is a means to provide XACT with time, position, and velocity (typically from a GPS receiver) valid at the previous PPS. Final byte of command must be transmitted to XACT within 750 ms after most recent PPS. NOTE: The provided solution MUST contain the velocity correction. XACT will use exactly the values commanded without correction.

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCmd_GotoEcefPoint
command.description: Slews to stare at an ECEF target defined by relative SlewEndTime (also transitions to Fine Reference Point mode if not already in it).

description.text: states: 0=Disable, 1=Enable; Apply velocity aberration correction to ECEF target

argument.description: states: 0=ECIx, 1=ECIy, 2=ECIz, 3=Sun, 4=Mag, 5=Moon, 6=Pos, 7=Vel, 8=TargECI, 9=TargECEF, 10=Bearing, 11=Heading, 12=OrbitNorm, 13=GcNadir, 14=GdNadir

description.text: Target ECEF geocentric X position
Target ECEF geocentric Y position
Target ECEF geocentric Z position

argument.description: +Z command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command). Points at ECEF target.
+X command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command). Points toward SecCmdDir.
Relative time (from time at which command is accepted) at which the maneuver is planned to begin pointing at the ECEF target.
Maneuver smoothing interval. Select smaller than SlewEndTime. Larger values give more smoothing but less agility. Recommend 5 seconds for general use. Less than 1 second is not recommended.

description.text: Select telemetry map
Telemetry map index to be used

command.name: cmd_adcs_TrackerCtrl_Table_Insert
command.description: Insert new values for table parameters. This is an alternate RAM table change method. Do not send without coordinating with BCT.

description.text: Which element in table structure to modify.
Which index if the element is an array.
Raw byte number 1
Raw byte number 2
Raw byte number 3
Raw byte number 4
Raw byte number 5
Raw byte number 6
Raw byte number 7
Raw byte number 8
Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCmd_GotoFineSunPoint
command.description: NOTE: THIS IS A MISSION MODE, NOT A FAULT/SAFE MODE. Go to fine reference sun point (transitions to Fine Reference Point mode if not already in it) with primary reference frame +Z on sun and secondary +X defined by parameter. Flag for payload assist (if available).

description.text: states: 0=Disable, 1=Enable; Apply velocity aberration correction to Sun vector

argument.description: states: 0=ECIx, 1=ECIy, 2=ECIz, 3=Sun, 4=Mag, 5=Moon, 6=Pos, 7=Vel, 8=spare, 9=spare, 10=spare, 11=spare, 12=OrbitNorm, 13=GcNadir, 14=GdNadir; Secondary reference direction

description.text: +Z command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command).
+X command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command).
Yaw angle of target frame about reference frame sun vector (+Z)

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCmd_GotoEciAttitude
command.description: Go to ECI attitude (transitions to Fine Reference Point mode if not already in it)

description.text: +Z command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command).
+X command direction (in body): 1-15 (see definition in GotoTarget command).
Commanded attitude quaternion_1. Or roll angle (deg) if quaternion_4 >= 2
Commanded attitude quaternion_2. Or pitch angle (deg) if quaternion_4 >= 2
Commanded attitude quaternion_3. Or yaw angle (deg) if quaternion_4 >= 2
Commanded attitude quaternion_4. If >= 2, q_1, q_2, q_3 are roll, pitch, yaw

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCtrl_GainSelect
command.description: Select desired set of table-defined attitude control gains. Note Index 1 is reserved for Sun Point gains, and Index 2 is reserved for nominal Fine Reference Point gains.

description.text: Five sets of gains from which to choose: 1-5.

argument.description: states: 0=Reinitialize, 1=Leave; reinitialize means reinitialize accel and rate limits to values corresponding to selected gain index accel, leave means leave rate limits at current values

command.name: cmd_adcs_TrackerCtrl_Store_Images
command.description: Store sequential images in memory for later downlink. Used existing StarId or Track image settings.

description.text: Number of images to store
Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_Refs_InitChebyshevSun
command.description: Initialize Chebyshev polynomial coefficients for spacecraft trajectory with respect to sun-centered inertial (J2000) coordinates

description.text: Start of polynomial - TAI seconds since Jan 1, 2000 00:00:00
End of polynomial - TAI seconds since Jan 1, 2000 00:00:00
C0 coefficient for the X position
C1 coefficient for the X position
C2 coefficient for the X position
C3 coefficient for the X position
C4 coefficient for the X position
C5 coefficient for the X position
C6 coefficient for the X position
C7 coefficient for the X position
C0 coefficient for the Y position
C1 coefficient for the Y position
C2 coefficient for the Y position
C3 coefficient for the Y position
C4 coefficient for the Y position
C5 coefficient for the Y position
C6 coefficient for the Y position
C7 coefficient for the Y position
C0 coefficient for the Z position
C1 coefficient for the Z position
C2 coefficient for the Z position
C3 coefficient for the Z position
C4 coefficient for the Z position
C5 coefficient for the Z position
C6 coefficient for the Z position
C7 coefficient for the Z position
Set current time in TAI seconds since 1 Jan, 2000 00:00:00.
Number of seconds
Begin star ID process. Transition to Track mode if enabled.

argument.description: 0=false, 1=true. ''True' means allow automatic transition to track mode. 'false' means stay in StarID mode -- do not transition to track.

description.text: Tracker number

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttCmd_TempSunRotationRate
command.description: Specify rotisserie rate while in Sun Point mode. Only valid for X seconds, at which point it will revert to previous value

description.text: Rate about sun-line in deg/sec
Seconds to use temporary rotation rate
Disables orbit propagation
Config byte must be set to 1
Enable or Disable IMU usage
states: 0=disable, 1=enable; Enable or Disable IMU usage

command.name: cmd_adcs_Refs_OrbitMethod
command.description: Method for orbit propagation. Kepler is recommended only for test. SGP4 should not be used when GPS is available and being used.

argument.description: states: 0=Kepler elements, 1=Point gravity, 2=J2 , 3=Spherical harmonic, 4=SGP4, 5=External Accel, 6=Polynomial

description.text: No operation. Increments command accept counter by 1.

command.name: cmd_adcs_AttDet_SetPreferredTracker
command.description: Sets preferred tracker usage configuration. Preference is used for attitude determination when available; otherwise only the highest-numbered available tracker is used.

description.text: states: 0=Both Trackers, 1=Tracker 1, 2=Tracker 2

command.name: cmd_adcs_Wheel_SetWheelMode
command.description: IDLE mode isolates windings. In INTERNAL mode commands come from internal software and the only direct external commands accepted are SetWheelMode and Calibrate. In EXTERNAL mode the wheel commands coming from XACT's internal attitude control system are ignored. For 3-wheel products, commands to 4th wheel are ignored.

description.text: Sets which wheel this command applies to (use zero to set all wheels)
states: 0=IDLE, 1=INTERNAL, 2=EXTERNAL

command.name: cmd_adcs_TrackerCtrl_VelocityAidDirect
command.description: Correct for velocity aberration using on-board velocity calculation with commanded velocity. DOES NOT requirevalid time/ephemeris on XACT, instead uses the commanded velocity for correction.

description.text: Tracker number
states: 1=enable, 0=disable
Spacecraft velocity with respect to sun-centered inertial frame, X-direction
Spacecraft velocity with respect to sun-centered inertial frame, Y-direction
Spacecraft velocity with respect to sun-centered inertial frame, Z-direction
Number of 5 Hz cycles to consider commanded data valid
Integration time used in Track mode

argument.description: states: 1=50ms, 2=75ms, 3=100ms, 4=125ms, 5=150ms; Integration time used in Track mode
states: 0=false, 1=true; True means the specified Tint is the maximum allowable time used by FSW auto select logic. 'false' means the time is fixed, and will not be changed by FSW.

description.text: Tracker number
Set time using data from Realtime Dynamics Processor (sent via test port).
Adjusts settings for external tracker interface
Tracker number

argument.description: states: 0=only allow NST solution when synced, 1=allow NST solution when not synced

command.name: cmd_adcs_GPS_GpsReinit
command.description: Re-configure GPS unit to output data packets expected by XACT (applicable to programs with serial link between XACT and GPS) . This command is necessary after any GPS reboot that is not followed by an XACT reboot.

description.text: Re-initialize subset of key software variables every Period.
Nnumber of software cycles between re-inits.
Tracker number
